item.title: SLAE32 Assignment 1 - Shell Bind TCP
item.description: This post introduces the first mission to my SLAE-32 journey. Introduction The main goal for the first SLAE-32 assignment is to develop a shellcode for bind TCP shell with the following requirements: The shellcode should be null-free; With the ability for the port to be easily configurable. In other words, the connection port should be easy to set up for the user. Bind TCP shell? What is this? Generally, a bind TCP shell or bind shell is created when a listening port is configured to redirect the input, output, and errors of an executable (mostly /bin/sh or /bin/bash) to an incoming connection.
